title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.001
frontText: What is block storage?
backText: A storage model that builds on contiguous sets of bytes known as blocks.

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.002
frontText: What is the difference between a virtual machine and a container when it comes to isolating computing resources?
backText: VMs run a guest operating system on a physical server. Containers use features of the host operating system to isolate processes and resources.

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.003
frontText: What is a persistent disk?
backText: A durable block storage system attached to virtual machines in Compute Engine or Kubernetes Engine

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.004
frontText: What is Cloud SQL?
backText: It is GCP’s managed relational database. It includes MySQL, SQL Server, and PostgreSQL.

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.005
frontText: What does the GCP service Cloud Armor protect against?
backText: Cloud Armor protects a Global Load Balancer against layer 3 and layer 4 distributed denial‐of‐service attacks and against layer 7 web attacks.

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.006
frontText: Which kind of Kubernetes instance executes workloads?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.007
frontText: What is the name of the smallest computational unit in a Kubernetes?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.008
frontText: What does the ReplicaSet Kubernetes component do?
backText: It ensures that the correct number of pods is running.

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.009
frontText: Which service is responsible for managing container images?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.010
frontText: What is a memory cache?
backText: A high‐speed, random‐access memory for storing frequently used data. GCP’s Memorystore provides a managed caching service.

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.011
frontText: What is a persistent disk?
backText: A durable block storage system for GCP. It’s available in solid‐state and hard disk drive types.

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.012
frontText: What is object storage?
backText: A storage system that manages data as objects, such as files. Cloud Storage is an object storage system

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.013
frontText: What is Cloud Storage?
backText: An object storage service providing web access to scalable storage. Objects can be stored in different storage classes providing different levels of availability and access charges. Durability is the same for all storage classes: 99.999999999 percent.

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.014
frontText: What are the storage classes in Cloud Storage?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.015
frontText: What is regional storage?
backText: A Cloud Storage class equivalent to Standard Storage except Regional Storage can be used only for objects stored in a single region.

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.016
frontText: What is multiregional storage?
backText: A class of Cloud Storage equivalent to Standard Storage that stores objects in dual regions or multiregions. This practice of storing objects in separate geographic areas is called georedundant storage.

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.017
frontText: Which storage classes are good options for infrequently accessed data? One is designed to be accessed no more than once a month, another is designed to be accessed no more than once every 90 days, while the other is designed to be accessed no more than once per year.
backText: Nearline (once per month), Coldline (once every 90 days), and Archive (once per year)

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.018
frontText: What is a bucket in terms of Cloud Storage?
backText: A container for holding objects in Cloud Storage. Bucket names are unique across Cloud Storage. Buckets have a geographic location and a storage class.

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.019
frontText: What is BigQuery?
backText: A petabyte‐scale data warehousing and analytics processing managed service that uses relational tables to organize data and SQL as the query language

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.020
frontText: What kind of databases do not use the relational model and do not require a fixed structure or schema?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.021
frontText: What is Cloud Firestore?
backText: A serverless, managed NoSQL document database used for storing, synchronizing, and querying mobile and web application data

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.022
frontText: What are some key factors to keep in mind when choosing a storage solution?
backText: Read and write patterns, consistency, transaction support, cost, and latency

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.023
frontText: When using versioning on a bucket, what is the latest version of the object called?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.024
frontText: What managed database services are used for relational, transaction‐oriented applications?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.025
frontText: What kind of data model is used by Cloud Firestore?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.026
frontText: What kind of bucket storage class cannot be changed to another class once it is set?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.027
frontText: What other Google Cloud Platform service does Cloud Spanner use when importing and exporting, in addition to Cloud Spanner?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.028
frontText: What is a Virtual Private Cloud (VPC)?
backText: A VPC defines a network, its regional subnets, firewall rules, and routing; it is a logical organization of cloud resources isolated from other resources on the same cloud. In GCP, VPCs are created for projects. Resources in different projects can communicate over Shared VPCs or VPC peering.

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.029
frontText: What is a subnet?
backText: A subnet is a subset of resources in a network that are logically separated from the other resources in the network. Subnets are assigned a set of IP addresses specified in a CIDR block.

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.030
frontText: What is a virtual private network (VPN)?
backText: A virtual private network (VPN) is a protocol for building a secure, encrypted tunnel to transmit data over the public internet between two private networks.

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.031
frontText: How do you control the flow of traffic between subnets in a VPC?
backText: By using firewall rules, which are applied to the subnets. Firewall rules are defined for within a VPC but the rules are technically applied to the individual virtual machines that are connected to the VPC.

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.032
frontText: What is the command to create a new VPC from the command line?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.033
frontText: When creating a subnet, which option controls if logs are sent to Cloud Logging?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.034
frontText: What is load balancing?
backText: The process of distributing workload across a set of servers

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.035
frontText: What are three characteristics that distinguish between the Google Cloud Platform load balancers?
backText: Global versus regional load balancing, external versus internal load balancing, and the protocols supported

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.036
frontText: What are the five types of load balancers?
backText: Global HTTP(S), Global SSL Proxy, Global TCP Proxy, Internal TCP/UDP, and Network TCP/UDP

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.037
frontText: What is HTTP/HTTPS load balancing?
backText: A global load balancer available in GCP. It is used to load balance HTTP and HTTPS traffic.

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.038
frontText: Which regional load balancer allows for load balancing based on IP protocol, address, and port?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.039
frontText: What is Cloud Deployment Manager?
backText: The GPC service for creating resources using a configuration file made up of resource specifications defined in YAML syntax

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.040
frontText: What is Identity Access Management (IAM)?
backText: A GCP service for implementing fine‐grained access controls on resources. It implements predefined and custom roles that are more narrowly tailored than older, primitive roles.

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.041
frontText: What is a service account in GCP?
backText: A form of identity that is used by an application or virtual machine. Service accounts can be assigned roles to enable the application or virtual machine to perform some tasks.

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.042
frontText: What are the three types of IAM roles?
backText: Basic (formerly called primitive), predefined, and custom

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.043
frontText: What is Cloud Operations? (formerly Stackdriver)
backText: A set of services for monitoring, logging, tracing, debugging infrastructure and applications in GCP and other platforms

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.044
frontText: What is Cloud Trace?
backText: A distributed tracing system for collecting latency data from an application that helps developers understand where applications are spending their time and to identify cases where performance is degrading

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.045
frontText: What is Cloud Debugger?
backText: An application debugger for inspecting the state of a running program that allows developers to insert log statements or take snapshots of the state of an application

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.046
frontText: What kind of services reduce the workload on systems administrators and DevOps engineers because they eliminate some of the work required when managing your own implementation of a platform?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.047
frontText: What type of VM can run for up to 24 hours before being shut down by Google Cloud?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.048
frontText: What service enables engineers to deploy an adequate number of instances needed to meet the load on a system?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.049
frontText: What practice integrates small amounts of new code frequently so that it can be tested and deployed rather than trying to release many changes at one time?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.050
frontText: In the context of IT services, what are disruptions that cause a service to be degraded or unavailable?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.051
frontText: What is General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.052
frontText: What is Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA)?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.053
frontText: What is the Sarbanes–Oxley Act (SOX)?
backText: A United States financial reporting regulation governing publicly traded companies

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.054
frontText: What type of expenditures are used to acquire assets, such as computer equipment, vehicles, and land?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.055
frontText: What is a key performance indicator (KPI)?
backText: A measure that provides information about how well a business or organization is achieving an important or key objective. For example, an online gaming company may have KPIs related to number of new players acquired each week, total number of player hours, and operational costs per player.

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.056
frontText: What is an operating budget?
backText: A budget allocating funds to meet the costs of labor, supplies, and other expenses related to performing the day‐to‐day operations of a business. Contrast this to capital expenditure budgets, which are used for longer‐term investments.

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.057
frontText: What is a service‐level agreement (SLA)?
backText: An agreement between a provider of a service and a customer using the service. SLAs define responsibilities for delivering a service and consequences when responsibilities are not met.

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.058
frontText: What is a service‐level indicator (SLI)?
backText: A metric that reflects how well a service‐level objective is being met. Examples include latency, throughput, and error rate.

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.059
frontText: What is a service‐level objective (SLO)?
backText: An agreed‐upon target for a measurable attribute of a service

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.060
frontText: What compute services in GCP can be used to run containers?
backText: Kubernetes Engine (GKE), Cloud Run, and App Engine Flexible

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.061
frontText: If you require a global, strongly consistent transactional data store, which GCP service is the best choice?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.062
frontText: When long‐term archival storage is required, what GCP service is the best option?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.063
frontText: What is a measure of users’ ability to access a working service over a period of time?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.064
frontText: What is a measure of the probability that a service will continue to function under some load for a period of time?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.065
frontText: What term describes the ability of a service to adapt its infrastructure to the load on the system?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.066
frontText: What measure describes the likelihood that a stored object will be retrievable in the future?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.067
frontText: What is the combination of all expenses related to maintaining a service called?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.068
frontText: What are the continuous operations of a system at sufficient capacity to meet the demands of ongoing workloads called?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.069
frontText: What is live migration?
backText: The process of moving virtual machines to other physical servers when there is a problem with a physical server or scheduled maintenance must occur

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.070
frontText: What specifies the configuration of VMs in a managed instance group?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.071
frontText: What is the name of Google Cloud’s managed Kubernetes service?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.072
frontText: Why are redundant network connections used between on‐premises data centers and GCP?
backText: To increase the availability of a network between on‐premises data centers and GCP. Multiple connections can also be used to increase the available bandwidth and improve performance.

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.073
frontText: Which tier of network services within GCP uses the public Internet for more than the last hop?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.074
frontText: Which tier of network services within GCP uses Google’s network as much as possible?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.075
frontText: Which GCP service is used for monitoring applications and infrastructure?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.076
frontText: Which GCP service is used for managing and reviewing logs?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.077
frontText: What kind of instance group does not support autoscaling?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.078
frontText: What is a canary deployment?
backText: A deployment to which a small amount of traffic is routed to test the deployment before releasing to all users

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.079
frontText: What does IOPS stand for?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.080
frontText: What GCP service provides infrastructure‐as‐a‐service in GCP?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.081
frontText: What GCP managed services run applications in language‐specific runtimes?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.082
frontText: What GCP service is used to manage encryption keys?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.083
frontText: What are Shielded VMs?
backText: Instances with enhanced security controls, including secure boot, vTPM, and integrity monitoring

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.084
frontText: What is a rolling update deployment strategy?
backText: A deployment that updates a minimal number of instances at a time until all instances are updated

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.085
frontText: What version of App Engine allows for using custom containers?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.086
frontText: What are the two types of nodes in a Kubernetes cluster?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.087
frontText: Which GCP compute service is well suited to event processing?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.088
frontText: What GCP service provides managed in‐memory caching?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.089
frontText: What GCP service offers fully managed MySQL, SQL Server, and PostgreSQL databases?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.090
frontText: What GCP data store option is the best choice for data warehousing and analytic processing?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.091
frontText: What kind of API call waits for the called function to complete before returning?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.092
frontText: What GCP service is useful for buffering data between services?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.093
frontText: What is a pull subscription in Cloud Pub/Sub?
backText: A subscription in which a service reads a message from a topic instead of waiting for it to be sent

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.094
frontText: The Apache Beam stream processing framework is implemented by which GCP service?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.095
frontText: Why do all buckets in Cloud Storage need to have a unique name?
backText: Google Cloud Storage uses a global namespace for bucket names, so all bucket names must have unique names.

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.096
frontText: What open source application allows users to mount Cloud Storage buckets as filesystems on Linux and macOS platforms?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.097
frontText: What three types of Cloud Storage classes are used for storing data that is not frequently accessed?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.098
frontText: What GCP managed service uses network‐attached storage and provides a filesystem that accessible from Compute Engine and Kubernetes Engine?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.099
frontText: What is the name of the fully managed, horizontally scalable relational database service in GCP?

title: fc871057.GoCCPCASG2E.100
frontText: What is the name of the GCP managed database service that stores data in tables organized by key‐value maps, and each row contains data about a single entity and is indexed by a row key?
